item.title: Damaris Zurell
item.description: Contact - Education - Career - Projects - Awards - Professional activities - Memberships Contact details Dr. Damaris Zurell Geography Department | Humboldt-Universität zu Berlin Unter den Linden 6 | D-10099 Berlin | Germany Office: Rudower Chaussee 16 | D-12489 Berlin | Room 1.209 Phone: +49 30 2093 6839 My institutional website Education 2011 – PhD in Geoecology, University of Potsdam, Inst. of Earth and Environmental Sciences 2007 – Diplom (M.

item.title: Publications
item.description: ResearcherID E-2439-2012. You can also find me on ResearchGate and GoogleScholar. Journal articles - Book chapters Peer-reviewed journal articles in press - 2019 - 2018 - 2017 - 2016 - 2015 - 2014 - 2013 - 2012 - pre 2012 - submitted in press 26 – Gallien L, Thornhill AH, Zurell D, Miller JT, Richardson DM (in press) Global predictors of alien plant establishment success: combining niche and trait proxies.

item.title: Join the lab

item.description: Lab alumni Research assistants 2017-2018 – Helge Gross (M.Sc.) – WSL, SCODA project (SNF) – data management and species distribution modelling 2017-2018 – Katarina Varga (M.Sc) – WSL, SCODA project (SNF) – ornithologist, bird territory mapping Switzerland 2015 – Helge Gross – Uni Potsdam and WSL – data management, habitat selection in white storks 2015 – Lena Schlag – Uni Potsdam and WSL – home range selection in white storks 2014-2015 – Merlin Schäfer – Uni Potsdam and WSL – computer scientist, optimal annual routine models for migratory animals Master 2013-2014 – Andreas Neumann – “Vorhersage von Artenvielfalt und -zusammensetzung mittels überlagerter Artverbreitungsmodelle (S-SDM)” – Diplom, Uni Potsdam, main Supervisor: Dr.

item.title: Downloads
item.description: You can download some of my codes from my github site. Repository IBM_OptimalForaging C++ codes for individual-based foraging model described in Zurell et al. (2015) Oikos. Repository Rcodes_MapNovelEnvironments_SDMs R codes for mapping novel environments (SDM inflated response curves and environmental overlap masks) described in Zurell et al. (2012) DDI.
